New York University Archives
New York University Archives Collection of Nineteenth-Century Correspondence
New York University. University Archives
Butler, Benjamin F., 1795-1858
MC.332
.25 Linear Feet in 1 folder in shared housing
1838 New York Universiy Archives serves as the final repository for the historical records of NYU. This collection consists of nineteenth-century correspondence collected by the New York University Archives. The collection contains an 1838 letter relating to financing for the construction of New York University's University Building, and the efforts of then-Attorney General Benjamin Franklin Butler to secure debt relief for the University in that matter. Materials are in English.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Robert and Nevine Melikian, August 2017. The accession number associated with this gift is 2019.074
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date (if known); New York University Archives Collection of Nineteenth-Century Correspondence; MC 332; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
Material was placed in a new acid-free folder and box.
Scope and Contents
This collection consists of nineteenth-century correspondence collected by the New York University Archives. The collection contains an 1838 letter relating to financing for the construction of New York University's University Building, and the efforts of then-Attorney General Benjamin Franklin Butler to secure debt relief for the University in that matter.
Conditions Governing Use
Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by the creator are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from repository. Please contact university-archives@nyu.edu.
Historical Note
New York Universiy Archives serves as the final repository for the historical records of NYU. Its primary purpose is to document the history of the University and to provide source material for administrators, faculty, students, alumni, and other members of the University community, as well as scholars, authors, and other interested persons who seek to evaluate the impact of the University's activities on the history of American social, cultural, and intellectual development.
